      • reviewUpdateProject

        public static String reviewUpdateProject(String curriculumBaseDir,
                                         String parentProjectUrl,
                                         String projectUrl)
                                  throws IOException
        Compare the parent and child projects to find differences. These differences include whether a node was added, deleted, moved, or not moved and whether the content for the node was modified.
        Parameters:
        curriculumBaseDir - the curriculum directory
        parentProjectUrl - the parent project url e.g. 236/wise4.project.json
        projectUrl - the child project url e.g. 235/wise4.project.json
        Returns:
        the results of the analysis of the difference between the parent and child project
        Throws:
        IOException

      • importAssetInContent

        public static String importAssetInContent(String fromAssetFileName,
                                          String fromAssetFileContent,
                                          File fromProjectAssetsFolder,
                                          File toProjectAssetsFolder)
        Import the asset from one project asset folder to another project asset folder
        Parameters:
        fromAssetFileName - the name of the file in the asset folder
        fromAssetFileContent - (optional) the content that we want to save to the to asset. if this is not provided we will obtain the content from the fromAssetFileName handle. this parameter is used when the content in the fromAssetFileName needs to be modified such as when file name references in the content need to be changed due to file name conflicts.
        fromProjectAssetsFolder - the asset folder in the from project
        toProjectAssetsFolder - the asset folder in the to project
        Returns:
        the name of the asset file that was created in the to project asset folder or null if we were unable to create the asset in the to project asset folder

        Parameters:
        fileName - the current file name
        counter - the number to add to the file name
        Returns:
        a new file name with '-' and a number added to the end

      • getProjectJSONObject

        public static JSONObject getProjectJSONObject(String projectUrl)
        Get the project JSONObject from the project url
        Parameters:
        projectUrl - the url to the project e.g. /Users/geoffreykwan/dev/apache-tomcat-5.5.27/webapps/curriculum/236/wise4.project.json

      • parseProjectJSONObject

        public static void parseProjectJSONObject(JSONObject projectJSON,
                                          HashMap<String,JSONObject> nodeIdToNodeOrSequence,
                                          HashMap<String,String> fileNameToNodeId,
                                          HashMap<String,String> nodeIdToStepNumber)
        Parse the project JSONObject to get all the nodes and sequences and put them into HashMaps so that we can quickly reference them by id later.
        Parameters:
        projectJSON - the project JSONObject
        nodeIdToNodeOrSequence - a HashMap that stores node id to node or sequence JSONObject
        fileNameToNodeId - a HashMap that stores filename to node id
        nodeIdToStepNumber - a HashMap that stores node id to step number

      • parseNodeStepNumbers

        public static void parseNodeStepNumbers(String stepNumber,
                                        JSONObject node,
                                        HashMap<String,JSONObject> nodeIdToNodeOrSequence,
                                        HashMap<String,String> nodeIdToStepNumber)
        Parse the project to calculate step numbers by traversing the project from start to finish.
        Parameters:
        stepNumber - the current step number, this will hold the activity numbers so that when we get to a step we can put the activity number together with the step number such as 1.1
        node - the current node
        nodeIdToNodeOrSequence - the HashMap that store node id to node JSONObject
        nodeIdToStepNumber - the HashMap that we will fill with node id to step number

      • compareSequences

        public static void compareSequences(JSONObject parentProjectNode,
                                    JSONObject childProjectNode,
                                    HashMap<String,JSONObject> parentNodeIdToNodeOrSequence,
                                    HashMap<String,JSONObject> childNodeIdToNodeOrSequence,
                                    HashMap<String,String> parentNodeIdToStepNumber,
                                    HashMap<String,String> childNodeIdToStepNumber,
                                    HashMap<String,String> nodeIdToStatus,
                                    HashMap<String,String> nodeIdToModified)
        Compare all the sequences in the parent project and the child project. We will determine whether an activity or a step was added, deleted, or moved.
        Parameters:
        parentProjectNode - the JSONObject for the parent project
        childProjectNode - the JSONObject for the child project

      • extractNodeIdsFromJSONArray

        public static void extractNodeIdsFromJSONArray(TreeSet<String> nodeIds,
                                               JSONArray nodeIdsArray)
        Extract the node ids from the JSONArray of node ids and add them to the given TreeSet. The TreeSet only contains unique values so we will not have any duplicates.
        Parameters:
        nodeIds - a TreeSet to store the node ids in
        nodeIdsArray - a JSONArray of node id strings

      • extractNodeIdsFromSequenceNodeJSONArray

        public static void extractNodeIdsFromSequenceNodeJSONArray(TreeSet<String> nodeIds,
                                                           JSONArray sequenceNodes)
        Extract sequence ids from an array of sequences and add them to the given TreeSet. The TreeSet only contains unique values so we will not have any duplicates.
        Parameters:
        nodeIds - a TreeSet to store the node ids in
        sequenceNodes - a JSONArray of sequence JSONObjects

      • compareFolder

        public static void compareFolder(File sourceLocation,
                                 File targetLocation,
                                 HashMap<String,String> parentFileNameToNodeId,
                                 HashMap<String,String> htmlToHt,
                                 HashMap<String,String> nodeIdToModified)
                          throws IOException
        Compares the files in the folders and checks whether they have been modified or not. This is a recursive function that implements deep traversal so that contents in child folders are also compared. This comparison is determining what changes, if any, have been made to the files in the child project.
        Parameters:
        sourceLocation - the folder of the parent project
        targetLocation - the folder of the child project
        Throws:
        IOException

      • compareFolderHelper

        public static void compareFolderHelper(File sourceLocation,
                                       File targetLocation,
                                       HashMap<String,String> parentFileNameToNodeId,
                                       HashMap<String,String> htmlToHt,
                                       HashMap<String,String> nodeIdToModified)
                                throws IOException
        Retrieves the files in the folders and calls compareFolder on all of those files.
        Parameters:
        sourceLocation - the file or folder from the parent project
        targetLocation - the file or folder from the child project
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addFileNamesToCollection

        public static void addFileNamesToCollection(TreeSet<String> fileNameCollection,
                                            String[] fileNames)
        Adds the file names from the array to the collection
        Parameters:
        fileNameCollection - collection that holds all the file names
        fileNames - an array of file names

      • getProjectUsageAndMax

        public static String getProjectUsageAndMax(String path,
                                           Long projectMaxTotalAssetsSizeLong)
        Get the amount of disk space this project uses and the max project size
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the project
        projectMaxTotalAssetsSizeLong - the max allowable project folder size
        Returns:
        a string specifying how much space the project is using and what the max allowable project folder size is as a fraction e.g. 100kb/10mb

      • getProjectSize

        public static String getProjectSize(String path)
        Returns the size in bytes of all of the files in the specified path/dirname
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the project folder
        Returns:
        the size of the folder in bytes as a string
